#summary Links to different sources of documentation for Pygr

= Introductions to Pygr =
  * [http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=1813952225455171972 a short talk about Pygr]
  * [http://www.doe-mbi.ucla.edu/~leec/newpygrdocs/pygr-draft4.pdf an overview paper about Pygr]

= Pygr-0.8 (latest) Docs =

On-line version:
  * [http://biodb.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/pygr_docs/0.8.0/html/ Overview].
  * [http://biodb.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/pygr_docs/0.8.0/html/guidelist.html Tutorials].
  * [http://biodb.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/pygr_docs/0.8.0/html/contents.html Module Documentation etc].
  * [http://biodb.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/pygr_docs/0.8.0/html/epydoc/ API reference].

  * [http://biodb.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/pygr_docs/0.8.0/html/guides/devguide.html Pygr Developer's Guide].
  * [http://biodb.bioinformatics.ucla.edu/pygr_docs/0.8.0/html/guides/libnclist.html Intervaldb C Library].

Alternatively, an off-line version can downloaded [http://pygr.googlecode.com/files/pygr-docs-0.8.0.tar.gz here].


= Pygr Papers =

  * [http://www.doe-mbi.ucla.edu/~leec/newpygrdocs/pygr-draft4.pdf Pygr: A Python graph framework for highly scalable comparative genomics and annotation database analysis]: this new Manuscript is intended to be an overview of the basic functionality of Pygr.  Please send feedback to [mailto:leec@chem.ucla.edu Chris Lee]!
  * [http://www.doe-mbi.ucla.edu/~leec/newpygrdocs/supplement1.pdf Code Examples] for the Pygr manuscript
  * for other papers see [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr/docs/ this page]


= Pygr Cookbook =
  * [http://bioinformatics.ucla.edu/forum/index.php?board=12.0 Pygr recipes]: this is currently being moved to the wiki, but for the moment look at this existing version


= Pygr 0.7 (old) Docs =

  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr_0_7_1/seq-align.html Tutorial].
  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr_0_7_1/sqlgraph-module.html Module Documentation].
  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr_0_7_1/testing-doc.html Testing].
  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr_0_7_1/intervaldb-doc.html Intervaldb C Library].


= Pygr Forum and Other Information =

  * DevelopmentRoadmap: plans for the next three releases of Pygr
  * [http://groups.google.com/group/pygr-dev?hl=en Pygr Developer Forum]: use this group to ask your questions about Pygr
  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr/docs/ Pygr Versions, Publications, Presentations]

= Talks =
  * [http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=1813952225455171972 Pygr and pygr.Data talk] at UCLA Bioinformatics retreat ([http://www.doe-mbi.ucla.edu/~leec/talks/UCLA%20Bioinfo08.pdf slides in PDF]): May 2008
  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr/docs/SciPy07Lee.pdf SciPy 2007 presentation]: August 2007.
  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr/docs/ISMB2006_PYGR_PPT.pdf ISMB 2006 Software Demo]: includes working examples from pygr tutorials.
  * [http://bioinfo.mbi.ucla.edu/pygr/docs/pygr2005.pdf ISMB 2005 tutorial]: a quick intro to the goals of the Pygr project; this was followed by running various code examples, more or less following the tutorial examples in the docs.
